conclusion: Objects A and B are placed down at the location of objects C, D, E, and F, and come into contact with them due to gravity.
Object A is positioned near object C on the left side of the table.
Object B is positioned near objects E and F on the right side of the table.
Object C is located near the edge of the table on the left side.
Object D is positioned farther back on the table, away from objects A and B.
Object E is a blue cuboid located near object F, a larger green cuboid.
When object A is set down, it hits object C and knocks C over the near edge of the table.
When object B is set down, it first makes contact with object E.
Object E is pushed into object F.
Object E is pushed partly under object F.
Object F, being heavier and having a higher center of mass, topples toward the sofa side of the table.
Object E slides in the same direction as object F and comes to rest beside (not under) F.
Object D is left undisturbed because it was not in the direct path of either object A or B.
Final state: Object C has fallen off the table toward the viewer.
Final state: Object F has toppled toward the sofa.
Final state: Object E has slid and stopped next to object F.
Final state: Object D has not moved.
